newsitem.title: UK: Euro oil swaps - Brent CFDs rocket on physical deal.
newsitem.headline: Euro oil swaps - Brent CFDs rocket on physical deal.

text.p: European oil swaps were steady or narrowly firmer, bar storming Brent crude CFDs which rocketed on the back of a physical cargo deal and fuel oil which dropped $2.
May 27-30 CFDs gained sharply to 12 cents over July compared with 2.5 cents under July on Thursday. Dated Brent jumped nearly 20 cents as a cargo due to load June 9-11 attracted July Brent +17 cents.

Further out CFDs were also stronger, but by a lesser degree. June 2-6 was around 12.5 cents under July compared, a rise of four cents or so while June 9-13 firmed to 13 cents under compared with 14 cents under.
Heavy fuel swaps fell $2 a tonne to trade at $82 for June barges although that level was well bid later.
Further forward the market was also under pressure with the third quarter talking $86.75 a tonne and the fourth $94 after trading at $94.75 on Thursday.
The first quarter next year remained some $3.75 a tonne above the fourth quarter which some dealers saw as too wide.
"If there are any time trades it probably selling that spread," said one.
Low sulphur was little changed after physical trade reported at $97 fob NWE on Thursday.
The third and fourth quarters were pegged around $98 and $102.50 respectively.
A June gasoline swap went at $209.75 although physical Eurograde barges had been sold earlier at $212 fob ARA. This eased back to $209-211.
Naphtha swaps were quiet with support from the physical market. June was fractionally stronger by 25-50 cents at $193 with July contangoed by 50 cents.
